name: Base64 decoding with shell utilities (freebsd)
description: Use common shell utilities to decode a base64-encoded text string and echo it to the console

data.command:
ENCODED=$(echo '#{message}' | b64encode -r -)
printf $ENCODED | b64decode -r
echo $ENCODED | b64decode -r
echo $(echo $ENCODED) | b64decode -r
echo $ENCODED > #{encoded_file} && b64encode -r #{encoded_file}
echo $ENCODED > #{encoded_file} && b64decode -r < #{encoded_file}
echo $ENCODED > #{encoded_file} && cat #{encoded_file} | b64decode -r
echo $ENCODED > #{encoded_file} && cat < #{encoded_file} | b64decode -r

input_arguments.name: message
input_arguments.description: Message to print to the screen
input_arguments.value: Hello from Atomic Red Team test T1140!

input_arguments.name: encoded_file
input_arguments.description: File to temporarily save encoded text
